intro: Coffea sahafaryensis, commonly known as the Sahafary coffee plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Ethiopia and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It thrives in high-altitude regions with cool temperatures and high rainfall. Due to its limited distribution and unique genetic makeup, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical research.
